intro: Glyptocaryopsis, commonly known as the African grassnut, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its spikelet-bearing inflorescences and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plants typically grow as perennial herbs or shrubs, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Glyptocaryopsis species are known for their small, wind-pollinated flowers and their ability to thrive in arid environments. The genus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
